definition:
A regular measure $\mu_R$ on a topological space $X$ is a measure on $X$
such that for each $A \in \mathcal{B}(X) $ , with $\mu_R (A) < \infty$),
and each $\varepsilon > 0$ there exist a compact subset $K$ of $X$ and
an open subset $G$ of $X$ with $K \subset A \subset G$, such that for
all sets $A' \in  \mathcal{B}(X)$ with $A' \subset G - K$, one has
$\mu_R(A') <\varepsilon$.
